contextId.information: This is an exclamation showing what Job wants very much but does not really expect it to happen. AT: "I wish that you would hide me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_exclamations]])
contextId.quote: Oh, that you would hide me

contextId.information: This exclamation tells what Job wishes for. It can be stated in active form. AT: "I wish that someone would write down my words" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_exclamations]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Oh, that my words were now written down

contextId.information: Job uses this exclamation to express a wish. AT: "I wish that I were as I was in past months" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_exclamations]])
contextId.quote: Oh, that I were as I was in the past months

contextId.information: Since God will not hear the prayers of prideful, evil men, it is even less likely that he will hear Job, who is complaining against him. AT: "So he certainly will not answer you ... that you are waiting for him!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_exclamations]])
contextId.quote: How much less will he answer you ... that you are waiting for him!
